data.title: Tech CEOs From Amazon, Facebook, Apple, Alphabet To Testify Before Congress
data.text: A Congressional antitrust investigation will have some star power testifying at hearings later this month, as the CEOs of Amazon, Apple. Alphabet (Google/YouTube) and Facebook have agreed to talk to the legislators. Congress has been casting a wary eye at the four tech giants, concerned that their market power is growing beyond acceptable limits. Jeff Bezos

data.title: Needham's Laura Martin says Facebook ad boycott could last through election
data.text: Needham's Laura Martin on how long the Facebook boycott could last and the impact on the company's stock. With CNBC's Dominic Chu and the Fast Money traders, Brian Kelly, Tim Seymour, Steve Grasso and Karen Finerman.

data.title: Facebook hit with complaint alleging widespread bias against Black workers
data.text: A Black Facebook Inc worker on Thursday filed a complaint claiming the social media giant's stated commitment to diversity and civil rights, including its support for the Black Lives Matter movement, masks widespread discrimination against Black workers.

data.title: Black Facebook employee and two job applicants file EEOC complaint alleging discrimination
data.text: One current Facebook manager and two job applicants have filed a charge with the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission alleging that Facebook has "a general policy of discrimination against Black applicants and workers, including in hiring, evaluations, promotions, and pay."

data.title: Black Employees Allege Racial Discrimination At Facebook In New Legal Complaint
data.text: The complaint calls on Facebook to make “dramatic changes” to fix the “unfairness, inequality, and hostility that Black workers experience every day.”

data.title: Zuckerberg says ad boycotters 'will be back' as more companies join movement: RPT
data.text: Zuckerberg spoke out on companies boycotting the social media platform, saying advertisers "will come back," according to The Information. Yahoo Finance’s On The Move panel weighs in.

data.title: Facebook Boycott 2020: 12 Things to Know About the July Protest
data.text:
Facebook (FB) is facing a 2020 boycott this month that will have companies pulling ads from the social media platform over hate speech.
The post Facebook Boycott 2020: 12 Things to Know About the July Protest appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Facebook will start telling you to wear a mask to prevent the spread of coronavirus
data.text: Both Facebook and Instagram users will see an alert at the top of their feeds that encourage wearing masks and direct users to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

data.title: Mark Zuckerberg: advertisers' boycott of Facebook will end 'soon enough'
data.text: Mark Zuckerberg has dismissed the threat of a punishing boycott from major advertisers pressing Facebook to take a stronger stand on hate speech and said they will be back “soon enough”.

data.title: Nifty FAANG and Other 'One Decision' Investment Strategies
data.text: If in early January, you’d have described to us everything that was to happen with the world and global economy and then asked us to guess where the stock market would be, we would not have guessed it would be at today’s level.

data.title: Zillow co-founder Spencer Rascoff on Facebook ad boycott, social media moderation
data.text: Spencer Rascoff, Zillow Group co-founder, joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss the mounting ad boycott against Facebook and moderating social media.

data.title: Facebook To Shutter TikTok Lookalike Service Lasso, Continue Rollout Of Reels On Instagram
data.text: Facebook is shuttering an app called Lasso, created as a rival to TikTok, less than two years after its U.S. launch. The social media giant informed users Wednesday night that Lasso would wind down July 10 even as it pursues a rollout of the Instagram video feature Reels, which could take Lasso’s place. Notifications to

data.title: Facebook to shut down experimental apps Hobbi, Lasso
data.text: The social media giant warned users that the apps will shut down on July 10.

data.title: Facebook is killing Lasso, its TikTok copycat app
data.text: The social network introduced the app — which allows users to make short form video clips similar to TikToks — back in November of 2018.

data.title: Tech leaders agree to testify on Capitol Hill
data.text: Apple, Google, Amazon and Facebook CEOs have all agreed to testify in House antitrust hearing. Yahoo Finance’s Daniel Howley joins The First Trade to discuss the details.

data.title: Facebook discovers it shared user data with at least 5,000 app developers after a cutoff data
data.text: Facebook accidentally allowed around 5,000 developers to access data from their app’s inactive users, even though that access should have been cut off.

data.title: Gary Vaynerchuk, Constellation brands executive on Facebook ad boycott
data.text: Gary Vaynerchuk, founder and CEO of digital strategy company VaynerMedia, and Robert Hanson, president of wine and spirits at Constellation Brands, join "Squawk Box" to discuss the on-going boycott of Facebook's advertising in response to concerns over content moderation policies.

data.title: Zuckerberg reluctant to change Facebook policies over ad boycott, report says
data.text: The Facebook CEO reportedly told employees he expects advertisers to return "soon enough."

data.title: Facebook is shutting down TikTok clone Lasso and Pinterest rival Hobbi
data.text: Facebook is planning to shut down TikTok rival Lasso and Pinterest rival Hobbi on July 10.

data.title: Facebook launches July 4th voter registration drive ahead of US elections
data.text: The social network aims to register 4 million voters.

data.title: Zuckerberg Tells Facebook Employees He's Not Going To Change Policies In Response To Advertiser Boycott
data.text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) CEO Mark Zuckerberg weighed in on the growing advertising boycott centered around the company and told employees that he was reluctant to bow to pressure and was not worried about the withdrawal of advertisers.

data.title: One in three major global brands considering pausing social media advertising, WFA finds
data.text: Stephan Loerke, CEO of the World Federation of Advertisers, discusses big brands' boycotting of Facebook as an advertising platform.

data.title: Facebook is shutting down Lasso, its TikTok clone
data.text: Facebook is no longer betting on Lasso, an app it launched a year and a half ago, to take on TikTok . The social juggernaut’s TikTok clone is shutting down on July 10, Facebook said.

data.title: Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Google CEOs Agree To Jointly Testify Before Congress In Antitrust Case
data.text: The chief executive officers of Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB), Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN), Apple Inc.
